intro: Artemisia michauxiana, commonly known as Michaux's wormwood, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flower heads that are clustered in panicles, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in woodland or open areas. Due to its medicinal properties and ecological value, it is valued in both traditional and modern herbal practices.
